subject: Van Pro haptics and simhub
description_text:
Hello

My van pro haptics keep disconnecting from sinhub.  I have to restart my
computer to get them to reconnect.   Once they disconnect that haptics stay
on (vibrate) in whatever position they were in until the computer is
restarted and connect back to sim hub.  Even when the computer is off they
will still vibrate.   I'm running simhub 9.10.3 and simsonn manager 2.1.0.
I have had the haptics for a few months and it just started doing this.

Thanks
Brian Pinnow
769-8354

conversations.body_text: Hi Brian Pinnow,    Hello, please connect the pedal’s USB cable directly to the USB 3.0 (blue) port on the back of your computer. Do not use a USB hub, and then test it again.

I have them in a USB 3 and they still do it.

Brian Pinnow
608 769 8354


On Sun, Oct 26, 2025 at 6:42 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Brian Pinnow,   May I ask if you are using the PlusX or ProX Ultra controller? If your computer cannot safely connect to the household ground via a three-prong plug, you can prepare an additional wire to connect one end of the controller casing to the computer case and the other end to the pedal’s metal screw. Please note that paint may affect the connection. This should resolve the issue.      https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

It is a pro x ultra.    I’m confused on the grounding.  You are saying to
connect to 3 points?  Controller, computer, and pedals?  Would I need 2
wires to do this?


Brian Pinnow
608 769 8354


On Tue, Nov 4, 2025 at 11:55 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi Brian Pinnow,  Yes, it requires two wires.
